what: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: package replaces strings package. New features: Cleaner code don’t need export intermediate “raw” “trim” files arguments specify templates Additional functions (e.g., ss_download_data()) Variable names consistent Climate Forecast conventions Formal tests helpful Error Warning messages Compile, format, visualize Water Quality (temperature, dissolved oxygen, salinity) data measured different sensors.

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: function tip calls function tail.

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: Centre Marine Applied Research (CMAR) coordinates extensive Coastal Monitoring Program measure Essential Ocean Variables around coast Nova Scotia, Canada. three main branches program: Water Quality, Currents, Waves. Processed data branch can viewed downloaded several sources, outlined CMAR Report & Data Access Cheat Sheet (download clickable links). sensorstrings package backbone data pipeline Water Quality branch Coastal Monitoring Program. used organize, compile, format, visualize data Water Quality data. Water Quality data (temperature, dissolved oxygen, salinity) collected using “sensor strings”. sensor string attached seafloor anchor suspended sub-surface buoy, autonomous sensors attached various depths (Figure 1). string typically includes three sensor models: Hobo, aquaMeasure, VR2AR (Table 1). Strings deployed station several months data measured every 1 minute 1 hour, depending sensor. Figure 1: Typical sensor string configuration (scale).  retrieval, data sensor exported separate csv file using manufacturer-specific software. type sensor generates data file unique columns header fields, poses significant challenge compiling data deployment single format analysis. sensorstrings package offers functions compile, format, convert units, visualize sensor string data. sensorstrings developed specifically streamline CMAR’s workflow, flexible enough users can apply process data accepted sensors (Table 1). Vignettes come information Water Quality data collection processing, visit CMAR Water Quality Data Collection & Processing Cheat Sheet (download clickable links).

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: Consider string deployed May 31, 2019 October 19, 2019 three sensors:

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: data sensor saved separate csv file, manufacturer-specific columns. Import raw data files: Examine first rows raw data file:
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "sensorstrings")  aquameasure_raw <- ss_read_aquameasure_data(   path = paste0(path, "/aquameasure"),    file_name = "aquameasure-670364.csv" )  hobo_raw <- ss_read_hobo_data(   path = paste0(path, "/hobo"),    file_name = "10755220.csv" )  vemco_raw <- ss_read_vemco_data(   path = paste0(path, "/vemco"),    file_name = "vemco-547109.csv" )

text: path File path folder aquameasure, hobo, vemco folder. sn_table data frame three columns: sensor_type, codesensor_serial_number, depth. deployment_dates data frame two columns. first column holds deployment date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day), second column holds retrieval date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day). sensor_make Make sensor compiled. match name folder raw data files. common entries "aquameasure", "hobo", "vemco".

what: Compile data from aquameasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data

text: Compile format temperature, dissolved oxygen, salinity,   /device depth data aquameasure sensors.

title: Compile data from aquameasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
Compile data from aquameasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: path File path hobo folder. sn_table data frame three columns: sensor_type, codesensor_serial_number, depth. deployment_dates data frame two columns. first column holds deployment date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day), second column holds retrieval date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day). trim Logical value indicating whether trim data dates specified deployment_dates. (Note: four hours added retrieval date account AST, e.g., case sensor retrieved 20:00 AST, 00:00 UTC next day.) Default trim = TRUE.

title: Compile data from aquameasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: Returns tibble data compiled aquameasure   files path/aquameasure.

title: Compile data from aquameasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: raw aquameasure data must saved folder named aquameasure   csv format. Folder name case-sensitive. Rows undefined ... (time set) values   Timestamp(UTC) column filtered . timestamp columns must order "ymd IMS p", "Ymd IMS p", "Ymd   HM", "Ymd HMS", "dmY HM", "dmY HMS". "ERR" values converted -111 (distinguish sensor   error value -101.5).

title: Compile data from aquameasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: Danielle Dempsey

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: dat Data tidy format, returned function convert_to_tidydata(). Must include least one column: DEPTH (factor, character, numeric).

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: Returns dat.tidy, DEPTH column converted   ordered factor.

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: use function plot_variables_at_depth(), DEPTH   must factor DEPTH mapped discrete color scale.   legend display correctly (e.g. depths arranged shallow   deep), DEPTH must ordered factor. DEPTH column may values can coerced class   numeric, qualitative descriptors, combination .   different level assigned unique values   DEPTH. cause confusion DEPTH includes   numeric qualitative values, example level (colour)   "Surface" level "2 m"). Qualitative DEPTH values standardized "Surface",   "Sub-surface", "Middle", "Bottom". Accepted qualitative DEPTH   values "Bottom", "bottom", "Middle", "middle", "Sub surface",   "Sub-Surface", Sub-surface", "sub surface", "sub-surface", "Sub", "sub",   "Surface", "surface". values cause function stop   error message. numeric depths: smallest value assigned first level,   second smallest value assigned second level, . qualitative depths: assigned order "Surface" < "Sub-surface" <   "Middle" < "Bottom".

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: Danielle Dempsey

what: Pressure correction factor for dissolved oxygen measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_pressure_correction
title: Pressure correction factor for dissolved oxygen measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_pressure_correction
text: Pressure correction factor dissolved oxygen measurements

title: Pressure correction factor for dissolved oxygen measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_pressure_correction
Pressure correction factor for dissolved oxygen measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_pressure_correction
text: dat_wide Data frame least one column: temperature_degree_c. Corresponding pressure (atm) data may included column pressure_atm. Additional columns ignored returned. sal single value salinity (psu). value must specified salinity_psu column dat_wide. Default sal = NULL. Note: sal specified salinity_psu column dat_wide, function stop error. p_atm single value barometric pressure (atm). value specified Pressure column dat_wide. Default p_atm = NULL. Note: p_atm specified pressure_atm column dat_wide, function stop error.

title: Pressure correction factor for dissolved oxygen measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_pressure_correction
text: Returns dat_wide additional column(s), F_p  pressure_atm.

title: Pressure correction factor for dissolved oxygen measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_pressure_correction
text: Dissolved oxygen concentration (partial pressure?) measurements   corrected atmospheric pressure pressure deviates   substantially 1 atm (Benson & Krause, 1984). function calculates pressure correction factor following Benson   Krause (1984), suggested USGS (2011). similar   described HOBO manual HOBO U26 Percent Saturation Calculation.pdf   (except function accounts salinity water vapour   calculation). Equation 24 Benson & Krause 1984: $$C_{p} = C_{star} * Pressure * (((1 - P_{wv} / Pressure) * (1 - theta   * Pressure)) / ((1 - P_{wv}) * (1 - theta)))$$ $$F_{p} = Pressure * (((1 - P_{wv} / Pressure) * (1 - theta *   Pressure)) / ((1 - P_{wv}) * (1 - theta)))$$ \(P_{wv}\) water vapour pressure, depends temperature   salinity \(theta\) depends second virial coefficient   oxygen, calculated using temperature (see Table 2 Benson   Krause 1984). References Benson, Bruce B., Krause, Daniel, (1984), concentration   isotopic fractionation oxygen dissolved freshwater seawater   equilibrium atmosphere, Limnology Oceanography, 3, doi:   10.4319/lo.1984.29.3.0620. USGS. Change Solubility Equations Oxygen Water. Technical   Memorandum 2011.03. USGS Office Water Quality, 2011.

what: Salinity correction factor for dissolved oxygen concentration measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_salinity_correction
title: Salinity correction factor for dissolved oxygen concentration measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_salinity_correction
text: Salinity correction factor dissolved oxygen concentration measurements

title: Salinity correction factor for dissolved oxygen concentration measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_salinity_correction
Salinity correction factor for dissolved oxygen concentration measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_salinity_correction
text: dat_wide Data frame least one column: temperature_degree_c. Corresponding salinity (psu) data may included column salinity_psu. Additional columns ignored returned. sal single value salinity (psu). value must specified Salinity column dat_wide. Default Sal = NULL. Note: Sal specified Salinity column dat_wide, function stop error. method Equation use calculate salinity correction factor. Options method = "garcia-gordon" (default) method = "benson-krause".

title: Salinity correction factor for dissolved oxygen concentration measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_salinity_correction
text: Returns dat_wide additional column(s), F_s  Salinity.

title: Salinity correction factor for dissolved oxygen concentration measurements — ss_dissolved_oxygen_salinity_correction
text: Dissolved oxygen concentration measured HOBO sensors needs   corrected salinity (see manual:   https://www.onsetcomp.com/files/manual_pdfs/15603-B-MAN-U26x.pdf). salinity correction factor can calculated using Benson   Krause 1984 equations Garcia Gordon 1992 equations.   equations used 0 < Temperature < 40 degrees Celcius, 0   < Salinity < 40 PSU 0.5 < Pressure < 1.1 atm. Benson & Krause, 1984: Used USGS DOTables (USGS, 2011). Results equation match USGS DOTABLES (part   C) https://water.usgs.gov/water-resources/software/DOTABLES/. Final term Equation 32: $$F_{s} = exp(-Salinity * (0.017674 - 10.754 / T_{Kelvin} + 2140.7 /   T_{Kelvin}^2))$$ Garcia &  Gordon, 1992: Garcia & Gordon re-fit Benson & Krause data higher order   polynomial defined scaled temperature (\(T_{s}\)). correction factor used SCOR WG 142 (Part C). Results equation similar Benson & Krause   correction factor (~4 decimal places). $$B0 = -6.24523E-3$$ $$B1 = -7.37614E-3$$ $$B2 = -1.03410E-2$$   $$B3 = -8.17083E-3$$ $$C0 = -4.88682E-7$$ $$F_{s} = exp(Salinity * (B0 + B1 * T_{s} + B2 * T_{s}^2 + B3 *   T_{s}^3) + C0 * Salinity^2)$$ $$T_{s} = log((298.15 - Temperature) / (273.15 + Temperature))$$ Note: HOBO Dissolved Oxygen Assistant Software salinity correction   factor uses form Garcia Gordon equation, different   coefficients (although results similar). References Benson, Bruce B., Krause, Daniel, (1984), concentration   isotopic fractionation oxygen dissolved freshwater seawater   equilibrium atmosphere, Limnology Oceanography, 3, doi:   10.4319/lo.1984.29.3.0620. Bittig, H. &.-J. (2016). SCOR WG 142: Quality Control Procedures   Oxygen Biogeochemical Sensors Floats Gliders.   Recommendations conversion oxygen quantities Bio-Argo   floats autonomous sensor platforms.   https://repository.oceanbestpractices.org/handle/11329/417. Garcia, H., L. Gordon (1992), Oxygen solubility seawater:   Better fitting equations, Limnol. Oceanogr., 37(6). USGS. Change Solubility Equations Oxygen Water. Technical   Memorandum 2011.03. USGS Office Water Quality, 2011.

title: Plot variables at depth — ss_ggplot_variables
text: dat Data frame sensor string data wide format, exported ]codess_compile_deployment_data(). measured_depth Logical argument indicating whether include sensor_depth_measured_m plotted variable. superchill Logical argument indicating whether adding shading indicate temperatures superchill threshold (<= - 0.7 degrees C). superchill = NULL (default), shading applied temperature values less equal threshold. color_palette Optional vector hex colors onto depth mapped. legend_name Name depth legend. Default legend_name = "Depth (m)". legend_position Position depth legend. Default legend.position = "right".

what: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: Extract information deployment log

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: path File path Log folder.

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: Returns list 4 elements. deployment_dates data   frame two columns: start_date (date deployment)  end_date (date retrieval). area_info data frame   five columns:county, waterbody, latitude,  longitude, station, lease. sn_table   data frame three columns: log_sensor (sensor name recorded   log), sensor_serial_number, depth (sensor depth   surface low tide Sensor_Depth column).  mooring_type character string indicating whether mooring   "fixed" (move tide) "float" (attached dock   floating mooriong).

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: log must saved folder called Log .csv, .xlsx .xls   format, must include following columns: Deployment_Waterbody: waterbody string deployed Location_Description: station name Lease#: located aquaculture site, lease number (NA   otherwise) Deployment: deployment date, order "Ymd" Retrieval: retrieval date, order "Ymd" Logger_Latitude: latitude string deployed Logger_Longitude longitude string deployed   (must negative value) Logger_Model type sensor; see options Serial# sensor serial number Sensor_Depth: Depth sensor deployed columns ignored. Entries Logger_Model column must include string   "aquameasure", "hobo", "tidbit", "vr2ar" (case sensitive). function stop Error one eligible   file (csv, .xlsx .xls) Log folder. function stop Error   Logger_Longitude positive value. Warning message printed console function   recognize sensor log. message printed console hobo, aquameasure, vemco   sensors found log. message printed console one unique   entry Deployment_Waterbody, Location_Description,   Deployment, Retrieval, Logger_Latitude,   Logger_Longitude.

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: Danielle Dempsey
